snippet: After pushing back its deficit-reduction target, the Spanish government is now struggling to discipline the regions that it blames for much of the problem.
abstract: Spain is struggling to discipline its regional governments, which it blames for exacerbating the country's fiscal problems, as it faces pressure from the European Union to rein in its deficit; Spain's budget minister, Cristobal Montoro, is in talks with regional leaders about how to clean up the nation's finances; Prime Min Mariano Rajoy is expected to present his own 2012 budget in late March.
lead_paragraph: After pushing back its deficit-reduction target, the Spanish government is now struggling to discipline the regions that it blames for much of the problem.

headline.main: Spain Struggles to Unite Regional Leaders on Cuts
headline.print_headline: Spain Struggles to Unite Regional Leaders on Cuts
